title: Electrician Vocabulary
description: Get wired into the language of electrical work with this enlightening terminology quiz.

questions.question: What is a 'circuit breaker'?
options: A person who damages electrical systems
An automatic switch that stops electrical flow when a circuit is overloaded

questions.question: What does 'amperage' measure?
options: The amount of electric current flowing through a circuit

questions.question: What is a 'conduit' in electrical work?
options: A tube or channel used to protect and route electrical wiring

questions.question: What does 'grounding' do in an electrical system?
options: Provides a safe path for stray electrical current to flow into the earth

questions.question: What is a 'junction box'?
options: An enclosed box where electrical wires are safely connected together

questions.question: What is a 'GFCI outlet'?
options: A ground fault circuit interrupter that shuts off power when it detects current leakage

questions.question: What does 'load' refer to in an electrical circuit?
options: Any device or component that consumes electrical power
The number of outlets on a circuit

questions.question: What is 'romex' commonly used for?
options: Non-metallic sheathed cable used for residential indoor wiring

questions.question: What does a 'multimeter' do?
options: Counts the number of circuits in a building
Measures voltage, current, and resistance in electrical circuits

questions.question: What is a 'three-way switch'?
options: A switch that controls three different lights
A pair of switches that allow a light to be controlled from two different locations
A switch with three settings: on, off, and dim

questions.question: What does 'watt' measure?
options: Electrical power, or the rate at which electrical energy is consumed

questions.question: What is 'knob and tube' wiring?
options: An early electrical wiring system using ceramic knobs and tubes as insulators

questions.question: What is a 'short circuit'?
options: A circuit with very short wires
An unintended path of low resistance that allows excessive current flow
A circuit that only works briefly

questions.question: What does 'gauge' refer to when discussing electrical wire?
options: The thickness or diameter of the wire
The length of the wire spool
The material the wire is made from
